meta.description: A company produces two kinds of products. A product of the first type requires 1/4 hours of assembly labor, 1/8 hours of testing, and $1.2 worth of raw materials. A product of the second type requires 1/3 hours of assembly, 1/3 hours of testing, and $0.9 worth of raw materials. Given the current personnel of the company, there can be at most 90 hours of assembly labor and 80 hours of testing each day. Suppose that up to 50 hours of overtime assembly labor can be scheduled, at a cost of $9 per hour. Products of the first and second type have a market value of $9 and $8 respectively. Try to maximize the daily profit of the company. Provide your answer rounded to the nearest dollar.

params.name: assembly_time
params.description: Assembly time required for each product type

params.name: testing_time
params.description: Testing time required for each product type

params.name: raw_material_cost
params.description: Raw material cost for each product type

params.name: market_value
params.description: Market value of each product type

params.name: max_assembly_hours
params.description: Maximum available assembly hours per day

params.name: max_testing_hours
params.description: Maximum available testing hours per day

params.name: overtime_cost
params.description: Cost per hour of overtime assembly labor

objective.name: profit
objective.expr: quicksum((market_value[p] - raw_material_cost[p]) * x[p] for p in P) - overtime_cost * overtime_hours

constraints.name: assembly_constraint
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(assembly_time[p] * x[p] for p in P) - overtime_hours

constraints.name: testing_constraint
constraints.expr_lhs: quicksum(testing_time[p] * x[p] for p in P)
